titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Kim Rogers Burdick received her bachelor's degree from State University of New York at Cortland, and an M.P.A. in Agency Management from the College of Urban Affairs at the University of Delaware. From 1981 to 1989, Burdick served as the coordinator of the Delaware Folklife Project. During that time she developed a statewide volunteer group whose goal was to document, promote, and preserve Delaware's traditional culture. As House-Senate Liaison in the Delaware Legislature, Kim Rogers Burdick designed Delaware's Coastal Heritage Greenway proposal, coordinated the 1991 Managed Growth Conference for the General Assembly, and initiated the establishment of Sussex County's Business People for the Bays citizens' action group. Prior to this position, she served for two years as Legislative Fellow to the House Natural Resources and Hazardous Waste Committees. Burdick has further advocated the creation of Delaware's Folklife program by lecturing extensively on Delaware's cultural history, assisting local historical societies, and educating Delaware teachers.

scopecontent.p: The Kim Rogers Burdick papers consist of material spanning the dates 1946-2001. Materials in the collection include brochures, newsletters, periodicals, newspaper and magazine articles, memoranda, correspondence, books, calendars, posters, certificates, drawings and plans, audio cassettes, and photographs. Organizations represented in the collection include the Delaware Press Association,Hispanic Historic Preservation, Quaker Hill, the Delaware Memorial at Gettysburg, and various hereditary societies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/burdickp.htm.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Delaware: Kim Rogers Burdick Papers Related to Delaware Folklife (265).
